p:
A suspension of J774-A1 macrophages (5 x 10
5 cells/mL) was seeded in 96-well microplates. The cells were allowed to attach for 24 h at 37 °C in a 5% CO 2 atmosphere. The medium was then replaced by different concentrations of essential oil (10-1,000 µg/mL). Amphotericin B was also evaluated (0.1-10 µg/mL). Cytotoxicity in J774-A1 macrophages was evaluated after 48 h using the standard MTT colorimetric assay
26 . The mitochondrial-dependent reduction of 3-(4.5-dimethylthiazol-2-yl)-2.5-diphenyl-tetrazolium bromide (MTT) to formazan was used to assess the possible cytotoxic effects of the test compounds on murine peritoneal macrophages
26 . The cytotoxic concentration that reduced cell viability by 50% (CC 50) was estimated by nonlinear regression analysis.
